name: ACP Local Government Platform
goal:
The objectives of the Platform are to:
• Promote the political recognition of local governments as a distinct actors in the ACP-EU cooperation;
• Represent, promote and protect, the interests of ACP local governments within the context of ACP-EU cooperation;
• Be recognised by ACP and EU governments to be the (sole) representative and consultative body in respect of all matters concerning local government within the ACP-EU cooperation framework and to make representations to both the ACP Group and the EU in respect of any matter concerning ACP local government;
• To be the united voice and representative of ACP local government within the ACP-EU cooperation framework.
• Promote and support at the ACP-EU level effective dialogue between (still to be completed);
• Promote integration into ACP-EU cooperation programmes concerns of ACP-LGs;
• Promote twinning and partnerships;
• Promote the mainstreaming of decentralisation policy in ACP-EU cooperation;
• Promote new mechanisms for dialogue and information flow and to this end gather, disseminate and share information on all matters relevant to LG and pursuit of these objectives;
• Strengthen the capacity of ACP local governments for dialogue;
• Establish, improve and strengthen conditions for effective dialogue between the Platform and the European Union;
• Develop a policy framework for cooperation between the ACP-EU and the ACP local governments at regional and national levels;
• Promote the adoption and implementation of policy frameworks.
• Promote the development and maintenance of systems of elected local government in the ACP States where such systems do not currently exist.
• Obtain and disseminate information on matters of importance to local government authorities.
It will seek to achieve these objectives by:
• Dialogue between the partners
• Information dissemination
• Programming, review and implementation of the Cotonou Agreement
• Capacity-building for local governments
euInitiatives:
Partnership Agreement ACP-EC signed in Cotonou on 23 June 2000 and revised in Luxemburg on 25 June 2005. In particular:
• Article 6 – Definitions of the actors of the partnership;
• Article 33 – Institutional development & capacity building; and
• Article 58 – Eligibility for financing.
In furtherance of strengthening ACP local government participation in ACP-EU development cooperation, the Platform:
• Represents, defends and promotes the interests of ACP local government effectively within ACP-EU framework – through:
­ Intervening in key events in order to make the voice of ACP local government heard and in the process highlighting issues of interest to ACP local government;
­ Providing information to ACP local government on various key development issues affecting ACP local government discussed at and/or arising from these events;
­ Contributing advocacy papers on a number of development issues to provide ACP local government input into development debates;
­ Developing numerous contacts with different development actors and promoting strategic alliances with various institutions for mutual interest.
• Provides information and networking services in order to improve ACP local government knowledge and understanding of ACP-EU cooperation – through:
­ Producing quarterly newsletters;
­ Through the website, providing networking services to ACP local government helping them to effectively participate in the ACP-EU development process and to share data and experience, thus increasing awareness of their role as key partners in the process;
­ Promoting and facilitating evidence-based learning in order to facilitate exchange of experience among ACP local government, on lessons learnt with local government participation in ACP-EU cooperation.
• Provides helpdesk and technical assistance to ACP local government in order to strengthen their capacity to participate in the ACP-EU cooperation process including provision of assistance for calls for proposals, registration in PADOR, etc.
